description.narrative: Output 3.3: Increased number of sites offer birth registration services in target counties, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3 - Children and adolescents are increasingly protected from exposure to HIV and AIDS, violence, abuse, exploitation and harmful cultural practices, and benefit from increased access to prevention, care, treatment, support, justice and other services needed to ensure their physical, mental and social wellbeing.

participating-org.narrative: THE NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR CHILDRENS SERVICES

sector.narrative: Legal identity (including birth registration/civil registration and vital statistics systems)

related-activity.ref: 2400/A0/06/003 OUTCOME 3: ENHANCED CHILD & ADOLESCENT PROTECTION AND HIV PREVENTION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: Increased number of sites offer birth registration services in target counties

description.narrative: Through the UN Legal Identity Agenda taskforce, chaired by UNICEF in support of strengthened civil registration, a joint Government of Kenya-UN Scope of Work document has been developed. Other achievements include digitization of 32.5 million civil registration records with equipment support for automation. Further support to Civil Registration Services (CRS) including support to develop a new Standard Operating Procedure, improving access to registration services online through the eCitizen platform, and by reviewing Civil Registration and Vital Statistics (CRVS) business processes and tools. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:05/01/2022

title.narrative: Existance of a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements(61542)
